intro: Grewia batangensis, commonly known as the batangensis bush, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The fruit is a small, hairy capsule that splits open to release seeds.
